paragraph: Mirna Doris (28 September 1940 – 27 March 2020) was an Italian Canzone Napoletana singer, mainly successful in the second half of the 1960s.

Born Annunziata Chiarelli, in Naples, after studying singing Doris started performing in street festivals and private parties in her hometown, and in 1962 she was a finalist at the Castrocaro Music Festival. Between 1963 and 1970 Doris entered the main competition at the Festival di Napoli, winning the competition in 1968 and in 1969 with the songs "Core spezzato" and "Preghiera a 'na mamma". During her career Doris also participated in several editions of Un disco per l'estate, Canzonissima and Festival delle rose. In 2020, at age 79, she died of cancer.
1974: Tre volti di Mirna Doris (Fonorex, VM 1301)
Pietro Gargano, Gioconda Marinelli. Mirna Doris. Regina e reginella. Una grande voce a difesa della canzone napoletana. Adriano Gallina Editore, 2002. ISBN 8887350272.
